bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Sidney Wallach, May 3, 1950

div1.p: Hench encourages Wallach to contact Siler, the secretary of the Walter Reed Memorial Association. Hench notes that there is a general feeling any funding should be spent on something more long-term than a publicity campaign.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Sidney Wallach, May 3, 1950
div1.opener:
Y F
May 3, 1950
Mr. Sidney Wallach
381 Fourth Avenue
New York 16, New York
My dear Mr. Wallach:
div1.p:
Have you gotten in touch with the
Washington members of the Walter Reed Memorial
Association? I would strongly urge that you
get in touch especially with Colonel J. F. Siler,
1835 Eye Street, Northwest, Washington 6, D. C.
He was ill last week but may be up and around
again. I do think that the members of the
Association have some suggestions which will
be very helpful to you and I believe it is
their general feeling that such sums of money
should be spent on something more profitable
than merely a publicity campaign.

I should be glad to be of any help
that I can.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
